title: Trying to understand archiving
content:
I'm trying to understand archiving, I've done a lot of searching and found nothing that answers my questions. I'm running Thunderbird 115.4.1 on Linux Mint 20.3. I have Keep message archives in "Archives" folder on Local Folders set, and Archive Options set to Keep existing folder structure of archived messages. I've (apparently) archived a few old messages, I say apparently because they disappeared from the folder they were in so I'm really hoping they still extant somewhere. And this is a Gmail account using imap.

Question 1: How do I determine where the archives are stored. They are not in ~/.thunderbird

Question 2: how do do I access them if I want to search for a read an old email?

Thank you in advance.

title: Not downloading emails from main account
content:
Hi

I've used Thunderbird (32bit) for years with no major problems but when someone sent me an "Invite" it was just a blank email that I got. The program said it was up to date (v68 I think) but I then discovered that the 64bit version was up to v115 and it had the necessary "calendar" (to see these Invites) built into it so I installed it and everything seemed to be fine after the upgrade except that I lost my Address Book (all the websites I saw said the upgrade would "handle" everything and none warned that Address Book should be exported BEFORE upgrading!), however, just from yesterday, TB has stopped downloading messages from (just) ONE of my ntlworld.com accounts!

When I click 'Get Messages' and look at the bottom I see it accessing all the accounts I have EXCEPT the main one I use!

Now, recently, for some unknown reason, Virgin Media LOCKED this mail account and I had to go through a whole load of palaver to get it up and running again! This, of course, involved accepting a new, ridiculously complex, password for the mail account but I did all that and once I had entered the new password into TB, the account worked fine all of last week.

However, as of yesterday, TB has stopped even trying to fetch the mail from the ntlworld server associated with my main email address (it gets the messages from my other ntlworld addresses no problem) and I can still SEND emails from my main ntlworld address! 

I looked in the saved passwords and noted that the new password is there against the smtp.ntlworld.com linked to this email address but there is no sign of a pop3.ntlworld.com line for this account or the associated password!

I can find no advice on how to manually add in this account and its password for a pop3 server and wondered if that was why TB was not downloading messages from that server/account anymore?

I have already tried deleting popstate.dat for the a/c in question and even tried deleting global-messages-db.sqlite (which meant I had to go into EVERY webmail for ALL of my accounts and delete ALL the messages in them to avoid the possibility of re-downloading thousands of emails!!!) but my suspicion is that the account not being listed in the saved passwords (just for pop3, the smtp password is there alongside this email address) is the root of the problem.

TB doesn't ASK me for a password for this account when getting messages it just doesn't attempt to fetch them from that account/server at all! (Everything is all properly set up & the account IS 'ticked' to be included when getting mail!)

Any ideas what the problem (actually) is and how to fix it? Any help is much appreciated, thank you.
creator: wb.cameron

title: Folders open in the middle of the list when sorted by date
content:
After the latest Thunderbird update to 115.4.2 (64-bit), when I open any folder to view emails, the place I land is now the middle of the list, even though it is sorted by date and the last email I looked at was the most recent.

This means every time I open any folder, I have to scroll through half the list to the latest emails. For example, the folder opens to emails from 2020 and have to scroll to 2023, every time.

Usually, if I open a folder I land on the most recent emails and this what I would like to set it back to doing, but I have looked for this setting and cannot find it.

Are there any solutions or suggestions to try?
creator: alana6

title: Incoming message will be opened in a new window prepared already as „Answer To“
content:
Hello, I hope somebody can help me in this case: I’m using four accounts for the family. Three accounts are working as usual, but one account is affected by an issue since a couple of days, after I have sent out an e-mail with the following options: - Request Receipt confirmation (MDN) - Request Delivery confirmationDSN - Save copy to Inbox The situation now is: 1. When opening a new incoming message by double-klick this one will be opened in a new window prepared already as „Answer“. That means: o In the right upper corner the buttons „Answer“, „Forward“, Archive“,… are missing. o In the left upper corner the button „send“ is already available. o The field for the target address is already filled. 2. Normally the following message should occure: ”To save your private sphaere Thunderbird has blocked external contens”, together with the option to show the external contens. But now instead: No such message, no such option available. 3. Following message instead: o No Identity has been found matching the e-mail address from the „From“-field. …… 4. The address field is already filled by address of the sender 5. URL’s sent by the sender are not working. 6. Following actions already done, without success: o Inbox (of affected account)/Properties/Repair: summary file new created o Upgrade to TB 115.4.2 o Troubleshooting- Mode performed o Start cache deleted (Help/Information for troubleshooting)

Attached is a sample/screenshot of incomming message, opened by double-klick. Thanks in advance Best Regards Detlef
creator: detlef.mueller1

title: How to see full mail adress from sender?
content:
Hi there!

How can I see the full mail adress in my list of received emails (instead of just a name)? It's kind of a security issue, since everybody can just pick any name. My friend Robert can send me a mail showing his name is PayPal. It's an open door to scammers and deception!

It seems like there were add-ons in the past "Show Adress Only" or "Full Adress Column" but they're not supported by new Thunderbird versions.

How come an add-on is needed to show such a simple and already received information? There are so many things that can be displayed but this important one seems missing. I would feel much better if I could see the real mail adress for any mail received without having to click on it. Thunderbird would feel more professional.

Are there any other supported add-ons to enable it? Why doesn't Mozilla add this function?

Best regards
creator: ectoberyl

title: no emails older than 30 days
content:
For the longest time I couldn't find out why my emails were automatically being deleted. Any email older than 30 days (sometimes even older than 2 weeks) were just gone. I left Thunderbird and switched to Bluemail instead for the past year or so. Then my emails weren't being deleted anymore. So I realized it was Thunderbird deleting them. I have a new laptop and thought I'd give TB another shot because I prefer it over any other email client. But I am concerned it'll happen again. I still use Bluemail on my phone.

Now I'm wondering if it was because TB compacted my folders. There wasn't any other setting indicating an automatic deletion of emails in the settings. They were all set to not delete emails.

Every time I start TB a popup appears asking me to compact my folders. I now think this is what was deleting my emails. I need access to all my old emails, especially from the past 3 years. I can't have them disappearing or being deleted. How can I fix this? Is the compacting folders the cause? How do I stop TB from asking me to compact my folders every time I start it? Thank you.

-- Matthew

title: l'evidenza di email non lette non funziona con cartelle nidificate
content: Buongiorno, sono Luca Ferrari, Vi segnalo che nella versione 115.4.2 (64 bit) di Thunderbird, al ricevimento di nuove email che con filtri popolano le cartelle locali, viene correttamente evidenziato al primo livello la presenza di email non lette, se però tale cartella ha sottocartelle interne che hanno a loro volta sotto cartelle ed una email nuova è stata spostata qui, al secondo livello non viene evidenziata e quindi non si sa quale cartella aprire per vedere l'email da leggere.... In allegato "email Thunderbird1" per il primo livello (si vede evidenza di email da leggere), "email Thunderbird2" per il secondo livello (non si vedono evidenze!), "email Thunderbird3" per il terzo livello (si vede evidenza di email da leggere che al secondo non era evidenziata). Spero di essere stato utile, PC con Win10 ma non credo dipenda da fattori esterni. Cordiali saluti

title: Google a PIA
content: I have a client that is responsible for sending emails to all members of a board of directors on a timely manner. All members are on Gmail. The client is also on Gmail. She has created a list in Outlook to send a monthly document. Sends it to the list. Google refuses to execute and does not notify until a day or so later. Error msg says the bulk mailing rule offended.(Rule says it comes into effect when 2500 emails sent but balks at a list of 40...go figure) The solution I am looking for would send to the list members one at a time 10 seconds apart sidestepping the Google Bulk email bulk mailing rule. Is there a way to script and call from an email list?

title: Post aggiornamento 115.4.2 tutte le mail e le cartelle personalizzate sono scomparse
content:
Ciao a tutti,

uso Thunderbird da un po' e mi sono sempre trovato bene. Tuttavia oggi all'accensione del PC, aprendo il programma mi si è aperto Google con la classica pagina "aggiornamento Thunderbird novità etc...", e fin qui nulla di nuovo. Il problema è che ora, al di là del fatto che trovo l'interfaccia molto più confusionaria e poco intuitiva, mi è sparito tutto. I vari account con le loro mail in elenco sottostante, le varie cartelle che avevo creato inserite in ogni account (bollette, documenti...) quello che vedo è quello che allego.

La cosa strana è che, come si vede a destra, pare che io riceva delle mail. Che però non appaiono. La mia domanda è: come posso vedere, come era di default prima di questo aggiornamento, i miei account con tutte le mail e le varie cartelle? Per intenderci MAIL1 posta in arrivo posta in uscita cartella MAIL2 posta in arrivo posta in uscita cartella

Grazie mille
